mdRecord.dcterms:title: Bref et sommaire recueil de ce qui a esté faict, & de l'ordre tenüe à la ioyeuse & triumphante entree de tres-puissant, tres-magnanime & tres-chrestien Prince Charles IX. de ce nom Roy de France, en sa bonne ville & cité de Paris, capitale de son Royaume, le Mardy sixiesme iour de Mars: Auec le couronnement de tres-haute, tres-illustre & tres-excellente Princesse Madame Elizabet d'Austriche son espouse, le Dimanche vingtcinquiesme
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bouquet, Simon, active 16th century [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Douglas H. Gordon Collection of French Books (University of Virginia) [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 53, [1], 10, 26, [1] leaves, [2] folded leaves of plates : ill. ; 26 cm. (4to)
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Title concluded: Et entree de ladicte dame en icelle ville le Ieudi XXIX. dudict mois de Mars, M.D.LXXXI. [original]
Signatures: A-N⁴ O² a-b⁴ c² A-G⁴ (leaf G4 is blank) [original]

Special title page and separate pagination for: C'est l'ordre et forme qui a este tenu au sacre & couronnement de tres-haute, tres-excellente, & tres-puissante princesse Madame Elizabet d'Austriche Roine de France: faict en l'Eglise de l'Abbaie sainct Denis en France le vingt cinquiesme iour de Mars, 1571. -- A Paris : De l'imprimerie de Denis du Pré, pour Oliuier Codoré ..., 1571. [original]
With 16 full page woodcuts (including 2 plates) by Olivier Codoré, who is named in the Extraict du priuilege. [original]

Leaves I2 and I3 are in their original state, leaf I2 with a foliated headpiece with small dolphin heads, and leaf I3 incorrectly signed Liij; on leaf G3r (3rd group) the description of Bouquet's responsibility for the text is printed in roman letters; without the 9 leaves of verse by Pasquier. -- Cf. Mortimer, R. French 16th cent. books, no. 205-206. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Notes in an unidentified hand on end flyleaf. Binder: Niedrée. Gordon Collection. Bookplate of Douglas Gordon. Gordon list, 511. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Charles, IX, King of France, 1550-1574
